description.value:
The warlock makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its Sword of Fathoms.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]] or begin choking. The choking creature is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} until the end of its next turn, when the effect ends on it.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

Blood Frenzy. The warlock has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. The warlock’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: eldritch blast (see “Actions” below), minor &Reference[ill]{illusion}

1/day each: armor of Agathys, arms of Hadar, counterspell, crown of madness, invisibility, hunger of Hadar.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Limited Amphibiousness. The warlock can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Shark Telepathy. The warlock can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

When a creature the warlock can see within 60 feet of it damages the warlock, the creature must make a [[/save dex 13 format=long]], taking [[/damage 2d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Special Notes: see “Actions” below.

A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 &Reference[force]{force} damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The &Reference[ill]{illusion} also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object--such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest--it must be no larger than a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube}. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the &Reference[ill]{illusion} for what it is, the &Reference[ill]{illusion} becomes faint to the creature.

You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

description.value:
A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
